title: System shutdown without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with one or more dirty .txt files, shutting down Windows causes the loss of changes in the .txt files. There is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their changes.
SR:
1. Open WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a new text file within the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Observe that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left-click on the Windows Start menu and select the 'Shut Down' command to shut down or reboot the computer.

Expected Results:
A warning or question message box should be displayed, allowing users to save their dirty files before the computer is shut down.
